chart_metadata.name: netbox
chart_metadata.description: NetBox is the leading solution for modeling and documenting modern networks.

groups.name: Container Image
groups.description: Image to be used for container

groups.name: Networking and Services
groups.description: Configure Network and Services for Container

groups.name: Storage and Persistence
groups.description: Persist and Share Data that is Separate from the Container

groups.name: Resources and Devices
groups.description: Specify Resources/Devices to be Allocated to Workload

attrs.label: Stop All
attrs.description: Stops All Running pods and hibernates cnpg

attrs.label: Replicas (Advanced)
attrs.description: Set the number of Replicas

attrs.label: Extra Environment Variables
attrs.description: Please be aware that some variables are set in the background, adding duplicates here might cause issues or prevent the app from starting...

attrs.label: Show Advanced Settings
attrs.description: Advanced settings are not covered by TrueCharts Support

attrs.label: Allowed Hosts
attrs.description: This is a list of valid fully-qualified domain names (FQDNs) for the NetBox server. NetBox will not permit write access to the server via any other hostnames. The first FQDN in the list will be treated as the preferred name. (127.0.0.1 and ::1) added automatically

attrs.label: Allowed URL Schemes
attrs.description: URL schemes that are allowed within links in NetBox.

attrs.label: Admins
attrs.description: Specify one or more name and email address tuples representing NetBox administrators. These people will be notified of application errors (assuming correct email settings are provided).

attrs.label: Auth Password Validators
attrs.description: Enable any desired validators for local account passwords below. For a list of included validators, please see the Django documentation at https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/stable/topics/auth/passwords/#password-validation.

attrs.label: Login Banner
attrs.description: Text to include on the login page above the login form. HTML is allowed

attrs.label: Top Banner
attrs.description: Optionally display a persistent banner at the top of every page.

attrs.label: Bottom Banner
attrs.description: Optionally display a persistent banner at the bottom of every page.

attrs.label: Changelog
attrs.description: Maximum number of days to retain logged changes. Set to 0 to retain changes indefinitely.

attrs.label: Job Results
attrs.description: Maximum number of days to retain job results (scripts and reports). Set to 0 to retain job results in the database indefinitely.

attrs.label: Prefer IPv4
attrs.description: When determining the primary IP address for a device, IPv6 is preferred over IPv4 by default.

attrs.label: Enforce Global Unique
attrs.description: Enforcement of unique IP space can be toggled on a per-VRF basis. To enforce unique IP space within the global table

attrs.label: CORS Origin Allow All
attrs.description: If CORS_ORIGIN_ALLOW_ALL is set to True, all origins will be allowed. Otherwise, define a list of allowed origins using either CORS_ORIGIN_WHITELIST or CORS_ORIGIN_REGEX_WHITELIST. For more information, see https://github.com/ottoyiu/django-cors-headers

subquestions.label: CORS Origin Whitelist
subquestions.description: Example 127.0.0.1

subquestions.label: CORS Origin Regex Whitelist
subquestions.description: Example r'^(https?://)?(\w+\.)?example\.com$'

attrs.label: CSRF Trusted Origin
attrs.description: Cross-Site-Request-Forgery-Attack settings. If Netbox is sitting behind a reverse proxy, you might need to set this

attrs.label: CSRF Cookie Name
attrs.description: The name to use for the csrf token cookie.

attrs.label: Session Cookie Name
attrs.description: The name to use for the session cookie.

attrs.label: Exempt View Permissions
attrs.description: Exempt certain models from the enforcement of view permissions. Models listed here will be viewable by all users and by anonymous users. List models in the form `<app>.<model>`. Add '*' to this list to exempt all models.

attrs.label: HTTP Proxies
attrs.description: HTTP proxies NetBox should use when sending outbound HTTP requests (e.g. for webhooks).

attrs.label: Internal IPs
attrs.description: IP addresses recognized as internal to the system. The debugging toolbar will be available only to clients accessing NetBox from an internal IP. (127.0.0.1 and ::1) added automatically

attrs.label: Login Persistence
attrs.description: Automatically reset the lifetime of a valid session upon each authenticated request. Enables users to remain authenticated to NetBox indefinitely.

attrs.label: Login Required
attrs.description: Setting this to true will permit only authenticated users to access any part of NetBox. By default, anonymous users are permitted to access most data in NetBox but not make any changes.

attrs.label: Login Timeout
attrs.description: The length of time (in seconds) for which a user will remain logged into the web UI before being prompted to re-authenticate.

attrs.label: Enable GraphQL
attrs.description: Enable GraphQL API.

attrs.label: Maps URl
attrs.description: Maps provider

attrs.label: Max Page Size
attrs.description: This setting defines the maximum limit of objects an API can request. Setting it to 0 or None will allow an API consumer to request all objects.

attrs.label: Paginate Count
attrs.description: Determine how many objects to display per page within a list.

attrs.label: Default Amperage
attrs.description: The default value for the amperage field when creating new power feeds.

attrs.label: Default Max Utilization
attrs.description: The default value (percentage) for the max_utilization field when creating new power feeds.

attrs.label: Default Voltage
attrs.description: The default value for the voltage field when creating new power feeds.

attrs.label: Rack
attrs.description: Rack elevation size defaults, in pixels. For best results, the ratio of width to height should be roughly 10:1.

attrs.label: Napalm
attrs.description: Credentials that NetBox will uses to authenticate to devices when connecting via NAPALM.

attrs.label: Args
attrs.description: NAPALM optional arguments (see http://napalm.readthedocs.io/en/latest/support/#optional-arguments).

attrs.label: Storage Backend
attrs.description: By default uploaded media is stored on the local filesystem. Using Django-storages is also supported. Provide the class path of the storage driver in storage_backend and any configuration options in storage_config.

attrs.label: RQ Default Timeout
attrs.description: Maximum execution time for background tasks, in seconds.

attrs.label: Remote Auth
attrs.description: Remote authentication support

attrs.label: Date Time
attrs.description: Date/time formatting. See the following link for supported formats https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/stable/ref/templates/builtins/#date

attrs.label: Plugins Config
attrs.description: Plugins configuration settings. These settings are used by various plugins that the user may have installed.

attrs.label: Main Service
attrs.description: The Primary service on which the healthcheck runs, often the webUI

attrs.label: Service Type
attrs.description: ClusterIP's are only internally available and Loadbalancer exposes the service using the system loadbalancer

attrs.label: LoadBalancer IP
attrs.description: MetalLB Only: Selects the Loadbalancer IP to expose on. Required when using PortalButton with MetalLB

attrs.label: Port
attrs.description: This port exposes the container port on the service

subquestions.description: Add External Interfaces
subquestions.label: Add external Interfaces

attrs.description: Please Specify Host Interface
attrs.label: Host Interface

attrs.description: Define how IP Address will be managed
attrs.label: IP Address Management

attrs.description: Specify type for IPAM
attrs.label: IPAM Type
Service Type
attrs.description: ClusterIP's are only internally available and Loadbalancer exposes the service using the system loadbalancer

attrs.label: LoadBalancer IP
attrs.description: MetalLB Only: Selects the Loadbalancer IP to expose on. Required when using PortalButton with MetalLB

subquestions.label: External IP's
subquestions.description: External IP's

subquestions.label: IP Family Policy
subquestions.description: Specify the IP Policy

subquestions.label: IP Families
subquestions.description: (Advanced) The IP Families that should be used

attrs.label: Target Port
attrs.description: This port exposes the container port on the service

attrs.label: App Config Storage
attrs.description: Stores the Application Configuration.

attrs.label: Type of Storage
attrs.description: Sets the persistence type, Anything other than PVC could break rollback!

attrs.label: Automatic Permissions Configuration
attrs.description: Automatically set permissions

subquestions.label: Run CHOWN
subquestions.description: It will run CHOWN on the path with the given fsGroup

subquestions.label: Run CHMOD
subquestions.description:
It will run CHMOD on the path with the given value</br>
Format should be 3 digits, e.g. 770

subquestions.label: Recursive
subquestions.description: It will run CHOWN and CHMOD recursively

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: Path inside the container the storage is mounted

attrs.label: Size quotum of Storage (Do NOT REDUCE after installation)
attrs.description: This value can ONLY be INCREASED after the installation

attrs.label: storageClass (Advanced)
attrs.description: sets the storageClass to something other than iX default. Only for advanced usecases!

attrs.label: Static Fixed PVC Bindings (Experimental)
attrs.description: Link a PVC to a specific storage location

attrs.label: mode
attrs.description:
disabled: use normal dynamic PVCs
smb: connect to an SMB share
nfs: connect to an NFS share

attrs.label: Server
attrs.description: server to connect to

attrs.label: Share
attrs.description: share to connect to

attrs.label: User
attrs.description: connecting user

attrs.label: Domain
attrs.description: user domain

attrs.label: Password
attrs.description: connecting password

attrs.label: Volume Snapshots (Experimental)
attrs.description: Add an entry to the list to force creation of a volumeSnapshot of this PVC

attrs.label: Name
attrs.description: WARNING: renaming this, means deletion of the snapshot with the old name!

attrs.label: volumeSnapshot Class Name (Advanced)
attrs.description: For use with PVCs using a non-default storageClass

attrs.description: Stores the Application Reports.

attrs.label: Userspace
attrs.description: Userspace Networking mode allows running Tailscale where you do not have access to create a VPN tunnel device.

attrs.description: Expose physical subnet routes to your entire Tailscale network.

attrs.label: Destination IP
attrs.description: Tells the DNAT mechanism which Destination IP to set in the IP header, and where to send packets that are matched.

attrs.description: The address on which to listen for SOCKS5 proxying into the tailscale net.

attrs.description: The address on which to listen for HTTP proxying into the tailscale net.

questions.label: Please read the documentation at https://truecharts.org
Please consider supporting TrueCharts, see https://truecharts.org/sponsor

4.0.0.app_readme:
NetBox is the leading solution for modeling and documenting modern networks.

This App is supplied by TrueCharts, for more information visit the manual: https://truecharts.org/charts/incubator/netbox

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!
4.0.0.detailed_readme:
README

General Info

TrueCharts can be installed as both normal Helm Charts or as Apps on TrueNAS SCALE. However only installations using the TrueNAS SCALE Apps system are supported.

For more information about this App, please check the docs on the TrueCharts website

This chart is not maintained by the upstream project and any issues with the chart should be raised here

Support

  • Please check our quick-start guides for TrueNAS SCALE.
  • See the Website
  • Check our Discord
  • Open a issue

Sponsor TrueCharts

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!

All Rights Reserved - The TrueCharts Project
4.0.0.changelog:
Important: for the complete changelog, please refer to the website

netbox-3.0.42 (2023-12-06)

netbox-3.0.42 (2023-12-06)

netbox-3.0.42 (2023-12-06)

netbox-3.0.41 (2023-12-03)

Chore

  • bump everything to ensure catalog has latest versions

netbox-3.0.40 (2023-12-02)

Chore

  • fix annotations again
  • update annotations
  • cleanup chart.yaml and add min-max scale version
  • Fix typo in categories and make them singular (#13693)

### Fix

  • ensure all questions.yaml can be rendered (#15612)

netbox-4.0.0 (2023-07-31)

Feat

  • hide advanced ingress options behind checbox (#9203)

### Fix

  • fix mistakes on questions.yaml

netbox-3.0.39 (2023-04-29)

Chore

  • update container image tccr.io/truecharts/netbox to v3.4.8 (#8498)

netbox-3.0.38 (2023-02-27)

Chore

  • update helm general non-major (#7725)

netbox-3.0.37 (2023-02-26)

Chore

  • update container image tccr.io/truecharts/netbox to 3.4.5

netbox-3.0.36 (2023-02-23)

Chore

chart_metadata.name: netbox
chart_metadata.description: NetBox is the leading solution for modeling and documenting modern networks.

groups.name: Container Image
groups.description: Image to be used for container

groups.name: Networking and Services
groups.description: Configure Network and Services for Container

groups.name: Storage and Persistence
groups.description: Persist and Share Data that is Separate from the Container

groups.name: Resources and Devices
groups.description: Specify Resources/Devices to be Allocated to Workload

attrs.label: Stop All
attrs.description: Stops All Running pods and hibernates cnpg

attrs.label: Replicas (Advanced)
attrs.description: Set the number of Replicas

attrs.label: Extra Environment Variables
attrs.description: Please be aware that some variables are set in the background, adding duplicates here might cause issues or prevent the app from starting...

attrs.label: Show Advanced Settings
attrs.description: Advanced settings are not covered by TrueCharts Support

attrs.label: Allowed Hosts
attrs.description: This is a list of valid fully-qualified domain names (FQDNs) for the NetBox server. NetBox will not permit write access to the server via any other hostnames. The first FQDN in the list will be treated as the preferred name. (127.0.0.1 and ::1) added automatically

attrs.label: Allowed URL Schemes
attrs.description: URL schemes that are allowed within links in NetBox.

attrs.label: Admins
attrs.description: Specify one or more name and email address tuples representing NetBox administrators. These people will be notified of application errors (assuming correct email settings are provided).

attrs.label: Auth Password Validators
attrs.description: Enable any desired validators for local account passwords below. For a list of included validators, please see the Django documentation at https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/stable/topics/auth/passwords/#password-validation.

attrs.label: Login Banner
attrs.description: Text to include on the login page above the login form. HTML is allowed

attrs.label: Top Banner
attrs.description: Optionally display a persistent banner at the top of every page.

attrs.label: Bottom Banner
attrs.description: Optionally display a persistent banner at the bottom of every page.

attrs.label: Changelog
attrs.description: Maximum number of days to retain logged changes. Set to 0 to retain changes indefinitely.

attrs.label: Job Results
attrs.description: Maximum number of days to retain job results (scripts and reports). Set to 0 to retain job results in the database indefinitely.

attrs.label: Prefer IPv4
attrs.description: When determining the primary IP address for a device, IPv6 is preferred over IPv4 by default.

attrs.label: Enforce Global Unique
attrs.description: Enforcement of unique IP space can be toggled on a per-VRF basis. To enforce unique IP space within the global table

attrs.label: CORS Origin Allow All
attrs.description: If CORS_ORIGIN_ALLOW_ALL is set to True, all origins will be allowed. Otherwise, define a list of allowed origins using either CORS_ORIGIN_WHITELIST or CORS_ORIGIN_REGEX_WHITELIST. For more information, see https://github.com/ottoyiu/django-cors-headers

subquestions.label: CORS Origin Whitelist
subquestions.description: Example 127.0.0.1

subquestions.label: CORS Origin Regex Whitelist
subquestions.description: Example r'^(https?://)?(\w+\.)?example\.com$'

attrs.label: CSRF Trusted Origin
attrs.description: Cross-Site-Request-Forgery-Attack settings. If Netbox is sitting behind a reverse proxy, you might need to set this

attrs.label: CSRF Cookie Name
attrs.description: The name to use for the csrf token cookie.

attrs.label: Session Cookie Name
attrs.description: The name to use for the session cookie.

attrs.label: Exempt View Permissions
attrs.description: Exempt certain models from the enforcement of view permissions. Models listed here will be viewable by all users and by anonymous users. List models in the form `<app>.<model>`. Add '*' to this list to exempt all models.

attrs.label: HTTP Proxies
attrs.description: HTTP proxies NetBox should use when sending outbound HTTP requests (e.g. for webhooks).

attrs.label: Internal IPs
attrs.description: IP addresses recognized as internal to the system. The debugging toolbar will be available only to clients accessing NetBox from an internal IP. (127.0.0.1 and ::1) added automatically

attrs.label: Login Persistence
attrs.description: Automatically reset the lifetime of a valid session upon each authenticated request. Enables users to remain authenticated to NetBox indefinitely.

attrs.label: Login Required
attrs.description: Setting this to true will permit only authenticated users to access any part of NetBox. By default, anonymous users are permitted to access most data in NetBox but not make any changes.

attrs.label: Login Timeout
attrs.description: The length of time (in seconds) for which a user will remain logged into the web UI before being prompted to re-authenticate.

attrs.label: Enable GraphQL
attrs.description: Enable GraphQL API.

attrs.label: Maps URl
attrs.description: Maps provider

attrs.label: Max Page Size
attrs.description: This setting defines the maximum limit of objects an API can request. Setting it to 0 or None will allow an API consumer to request all objects.

attrs.label: Paginate Count
attrs.description: Determine how many objects to display per page within a list.

attrs.label: Default Amperage
attrs.description: The default value for the amperage field when creating new power feeds.

attrs.label: Default Max Utilization
attrs.description: The default value (percentage) for the max_utilization field when creating new power feeds.

attrs.label: Default Voltage
attrs.description: The default value for the voltage field when creating new power feeds.

attrs.label: Rack
attrs.description: Rack elevation size defaults, in pixels. For best results, the ratio of width to height should be roughly 10:1.

attrs.label: Napalm
attrs.description: Credentials that NetBox will uses to authenticate to devices when connecting via NAPALM.

attrs.label: Args
attrs.description: NAPALM optional arguments (see http://napalm.readthedocs.io/en/latest/support/#optional-arguments).

attrs.label: Storage Backend
attrs.description: By default uploaded media is stored on the local filesystem. Using Django-storages is also supported. Provide the class path of the storage driver in storage_backend and any configuration options in storage_config.

attrs.label: RQ Default Timeout
attrs.description: Maximum execution time for background tasks, in seconds.

attrs.label: Remote Auth
attrs.description: Remote authentication support

attrs.label: Date Time
attrs.description: Date/time formatting. See the following link for supported formats https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/stable/ref/templates/builtins/#date

attrs.label: Plugins Config
attrs.description: Plugins configuration settings. These settings are used by various plugins that the user may have installed.

attrs.label: Main Service
attrs.description: The Primary service on which the healthcheck runs, often the webUI

attrs.label: Service Type
attrs.description: ClusterIP's are only internally available and Loadbalancer exposes the service using the system loadbalancer

attrs.label: LoadBalancer IP
attrs.description: MetalLB Only: Selects the Loadbalancer IP to expose on. Required when using PortalButton with MetalLB

attrs.label: Port
attrs.description: This port exposes the container port on the service

attrs.description: Stores the Application Configuration.

attrs.label: Type of Storage
attrs.description: Sets the persistence type, Anything other than PVC could break rollback!

attrs.label: Automatic Permissions Configuration
attrs.description: Automatically set permissions

subquestions.label: Run CHOWN
subquestions.description: It will run CHOWN on the path with the given fsGroup

subquestions.label: Run CHMOD
subquestions.description:
It will run CHMOD on the path with the given value</br>
Format should be 3 digits, e.g. 770

subquestions.label: Recursive
subquestions.description: It will run CHOWN and CHMOD recursively

attrs.label: Host Path
attrs.description: Path inside the container the storage is mounted

attrs.label: Size quotum of Storage (Do NOT REDUCE after installation)
attrs.description: This value can ONLY be INCREASED after the installation

attrs.label: storageClass (Advanced)
attrs.description: sets the storageClass to something other than iX default. Only for advanced usecases!

attrs.description: Link a PVC to a specific storage location

attrs.description:
disabled: use normal dynamic PVCs
smb: connect to an SMB share
nfs: connect to an NFS share

Please consider supporting TrueCharts, see https://truecharts.org/sponsor

3.0.42.app_readme:
NetBox is the leading solution for modeling and documenting modern networks.

This App is supplied by TrueCharts, for more information visit the manual: https://truecharts.org/charts/incubator/netbox

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!
3.0.42.detailed_readme:
README

General Info

TrueCharts can be installed as both normal Helm Charts or as Apps on TrueNAS SCALE. However only installations using the TrueNAS SCALE Apps system are supported.

For more information about this App, please check the docs on the TrueCharts website

This chart is not maintained by the upstream project and any issues with the chart should be raised here

Support

  • Please check our quick-start guides for TrueNAS SCALE.
  • See the Website
  • Check our Discord
  • Open a issue

Sponsor TrueCharts

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!

All Rights Reserved - The TrueCharts Project
